sentence.Network_en: Demand picked up and a reprint was required last November.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于需求量上升，去年11月，再版已是势在必行。

sentence.Network_en: Don't bug private conversations, and don't buy papers that reprint them.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要窃听私人谈话，不要购买重印这些谈话的报纸。

sentence.Network_en: Grateful acknowledgment is made for permission to reprint.
sentence.Network_cn: 为获准重印致以深切感谢。

entry.def: If a book is reprinted, further copies of it are printed when all the other ones have been sold.

example.ex: It remained an exceptionally rare book until it was reprinted in 1918.
example.tran: 在1918年再版之前，这本书一直非常罕见。

entry.def: A reprint is a process in which new copies of a book or article are printed because all the other ones have been sold.

example.ex: Demand picked up and a reprint was required last November.
example.tran: 由于需求量上升，去年11月，再版已是势在必行。

entry.def: A reprint is a new copy of a book or article, printed because all the other ones have been sold or because minor changes have been made to the original.

means.word_mean: 1. a publication (such as a book) that is reprinted without changes or editing and offered again for sale
2. a separately printed article that originally appeared in a larger publication

sentences.en: The newspaper reprinted the facts, without fear or favour.
sentences.cn: 报纸公正地转载了事情的真相。

sentences.en: The book is reprinting;you’ll be able to buy one soon.
sentences.cn: 这书正重印, 你不久就可以买到。
